docsIetfBpi2MIB.description: This is the MIB module for the DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface (BPI+) at cable modems (CMs) and cable modem termination systems (CMTSs). Copyright (C) The Internet Society (2004). This version of this MIB module is part of RFC XXXX; see the RFC itself for full legal notices.

DocsX509ASN1DEREncodedCertificate.name: DocsX509ASN1DEREncodedCertificate
DocsX509ASN1DEREncodedCertificate.description: An X509 digital certificate encoded as an ASN.1 DER object.

DocsSAId.name: DocsSAId
DocsSAId.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface specification, Section 2.1.3 BPI+ Security Associations

DocsSAIdOrZero.name: DocsSAIdOrZero
DocsSAIdOrZero.description: Security Association identifier (SAId). The value zero indicates the SAId is yet to be determined
DocsSAIdOrZero.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface specification, Section 2.1.3 BPI+ Security Associations

DocsBpkmSAType.name: DocsBpkmSAType
DocsBpkmSAType.description: The type of security association (SA). The values of the named-numbers are associated with the BPKM SA-Type attributes: 'primary' corresponds to code '1', 'static' to code '2' 'dynamic' to code '3'. 'none' value must only be used if the SA type has yet to be determined.
DocsBpkmSAType.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface specification, Section 4.2.2.24

DocsBpkmDataEncryptAlg.name: DocsBpkmDataEncryptAlg
DocsBpkmDataEncryptAlg.description: The list of data encryption algorithms defined for the DOCSIS interface in the BPKM cryptographic-suite parameter. The Value 'none' is indicates that the SAID being referenced has no data encryption.
DocsBpkmDataEncryptAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.

DocsBpkmDataAuthentAlg.name: DocsBpkmDataAuthentAlg
DocsBpkmDataAuthentAlg.description: The list of data integrity algorithms defined for the DOCSIS interface in the BPKM cryptographic-suite parameter. The value 'none' indicates no data integrity is used for the SAID being referenced.
DocsBpkmDataAuthentAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.

docsIetfBpi2CmBaseTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmBaseTable
docsIetfBpi2CmBaseTable.description: This table describes the basic and authorization related Baseline Privacy Plus attributes of each CM MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmBaseEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmBaseEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmBaseEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing attributes of one CM MAC interface. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMaclayer(127).

docsIetfBpi2CmPrivacyEnable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmPrivacyEnable
docsIetfBpi2CmPrivacyEnable.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmPrivacyEnable.description: This object identifies whether this CM is provisioned to run Baseline Privacy Plus.

docsIetfBpi2CmPublicKey.name: docsIetfBpi2CmPublicKey
docsIetfBpi2CmPublicKey.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmPublicKey.description: The value of this object is a DER-encoded RSAPublicKey ASN.1 type string, as defined in the RSA Encryption Standard (PKCS #1), corresponding to the public key of the CM.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthState.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthState
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthState.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.1.2.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthState.description: The value of this object is the state of the CM authorization FSM. The start state indicates that FSM is in its initial state.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthKeySequenceNumber.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthKeySequenceNumber
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthKeySequenceNumber.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.2 and 4.2.2.10.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthKeySequenceNumber.description: The value of this object is the most recent authorization key sequence number for this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresOld.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresOld
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresOld.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.2 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresOld.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the immediate predecessor of the most recent authorization key for this FSM. If this FSM has only one authorization key, then the value is the time of activation of this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresNew.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresNew
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresNew.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.2 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthExpiresNew.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the most recent authorization key for this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReset.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReset
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReset.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.1.2.3.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReset.description: Setting this object to 'true' generates a Reauthorize event in the authorization FSM. Reading this object always returns FALSE. This object is for testing purposes only and therefore it does not require to be associated with a last reset object.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthGraceTime.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthGraceTime
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthGraceTime.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthGraceTime.description: The value of this object is the grace time for an authorization key in seconds. A CM is expected to start trying to get a new authorization key beginning AuthGraceTime seconds before the most recent authorization key actually expires.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKGraceTime.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKGraceTime
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKGraceTime.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKGraceTime.description: The value of this object is the grace time for the TEK in seconds. The CM is expected to start trying to acquire a new TEK beginning TEK GraceTime seconds before the expiration of the most recent TEK.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthWaitTimeout.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthWaitTimeout
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthWaitTimeout.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthWaitTimeout.description: The value of this object is the Authorize Wait Timeout in second.

docsIetfBpi2CmReauthWaitTimeout.name: docsIetfBpi2CmReauthWaitTimeout
docsIetfBpi2CmReauthWaitTimeout.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmReauthWaitTimeout.description: The value of this object is the Reauthorize Wait Timeout in seconds.

docsIetfBpi2CmOpWaitTimeout.name: docsIetfBpi2CmOpWaitTimeout
docsIetfBpi2CmOpWaitTimeout.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmOpWaitTimeout.description: The value of this object is the Operational Wait Timeout in seconds.

docsIetfBpi2CmRekeyWaitTimeout.name: docsIetfBpi2CmRekeyWaitTimeout
docsIetfBpi2CmRekeyWaitTimeout.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.5.
docsIetfBpi2CmRekeyWaitTimeout.description: The value of this object is the Rekey Wait Timeout in seconds.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectWaitTimeout.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectWaitTimeout
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectWaitTimeout.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.7.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectWaitTimeout.description: The value of this object is the Authorization Reject Wait Timeout in seconds.

docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapWaitTimeout.name: docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapWaitTimeout
docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapWaitTimeout.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.8.
docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapWaitTimeout.description: The value of this object is the retransmission interval, in seconds, of SA Map Requests from the MAP Wait state.

docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapMaxRetries.name: docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapMaxRetries
docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapMaxRetries.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.1.1.1.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmSAMapMaxRetries.description: The value of this object is the maximum number of Map Request retries allowed.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthentInfos.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthentInfos
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthentInfos.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthentInfos.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has transmitted an Authentication Information message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has transmitted an Authorization Request message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received an Authorization Reply message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received an Authorization Reject message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalids.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalids
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalids.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.7.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalids.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received an Authorization Invalid message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.3 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in most recent Authorization Reject message received by the CM. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no Authorization Reject message has been received since reboot.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.3 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthRejectErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in most recent Authorization Reject message received by the CM. This is a zero length string if no Authorization Reject message has been received since reboot.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.7 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in most recent Authorization Invalid message received by the CM. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no Authorization Invalid message has been received since reboot.

docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.7 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmAuthInvalidErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in most recent Authorization Invalid message received by the CM. This is a zero length string if no Authorization Invalid message has been received since reboot.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKTable
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKTable.description: This table describes the attributes of each CM Traffic Encryption Key (TEK) association. The CM maintains (no more than) one TEK association per SAID per CM MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing the TEK association attributes of one SAID. The CM MUST create one entry per SAID, regardless of whether the SAID was obtained from a Registration Response message, from an Authorization Reply message, or from any dynamic SAID establishment mechanisms.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAId.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAId
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAId.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.12.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAId.description: The value of this object is the DOCSIS Security Association ID (SAID).

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAType.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAType
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAType.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKSAType.description: The value of this object is the type of security association.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataEncryptAlg.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataEncryptAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataEncryptAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataEncryptAlg.description: The value of this object is the data encryption algorithm for this SAID.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataAuthentAlg.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataAuthentAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataAuthentAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKDataAuthentAlg.description: The value of this object is the data authentication algorithm for this SAID.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKState.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKState
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKState.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.1.3.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKState.description: The value of this object is the state of the indicated TEK FSM. The start(1) state indicates that FSM is in its initial state.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeySequenceNumber.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeySequenceNumber
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeySequenceNumber.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.2.10 and 4.2.2.13.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeySequenceNumber.description: The value of this object is the most recent TEK key sequence number for this TEK FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresOld.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresOld
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresOld.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.5 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresOld.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the immediate predecessor of the most recent TEK for this FSM. If this FSM has only one TEK, then the value is the time of activation of this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresNew.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresNew
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresNew.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.5 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKExpiresNew.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the most recent TEK for this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has transmitted a Key Request message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.5.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received a Key Reply message, including a message whose authentication failed. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received a Key Reject message, including a message whose authentication failed. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalids.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalids
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalids.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.8.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalids.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received a TEK Invalid message, including a message whose authentication failed. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKAuthPends.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKAuthPends
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKAuthPends.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.1.3.3.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKAuthPends.description: The value of this object is the count of times an Authorization Pending (Auth Pend) event occurred in this FSM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.1.2.6 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in most recent Key Reject message received by the CM. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no Key Reject message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.1.2.6 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKKeyRejectErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in most recent Key Reject message received by the CM. This is a zero length string if no Key Reject message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.1.2.8 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in most recent TEK Invalid message received by the CM. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no TEK Invalid message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.1.2.8 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmTEKInvalidErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in most recent TEK Invalid message received by the CM. This is a zero length string if no TEK Invalid message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastMapTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastMapTable
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastMapTable.description: This table maps multicast IP addresses to SAIDs per CM MAC Interface. It is intended to map multicast IP addresses associated with SA MAP Request messages.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastMapEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastMapEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastMapEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing the mapping of one multicast IP address to one SAID, as well as associated state, message counters, and error information. An entry may be removed from this table upon the reception of an SA Map Reject.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddressType.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddressType
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddressType.description: The type of internet address for docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddress.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddress.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddress
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddress.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 5.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddress.description: This object represents the IP multicast address to be mapped. The type of this address is determined by the value of the docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastAddressType object.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAId.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAId
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAId.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.12.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAId.description: This object represents the SAID to which the IP multicast address has been mapped. If no SA Map Reply has been received for the IP address, this object should have the value 0.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapState.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapState
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapState.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 5.3.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapState.description: The value of this object is the state of the SA Mapping FSM for this IP.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.10.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has transmitted an SA Map Request message for this IP. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.11.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received an SA Map Reply message for this IP. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.12.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CM has received an SA MAP Reject message for this IP. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErro.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErro.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.12 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErro.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in the most recent SA Map Reject message sent in response to an SA Map Request for This IP. It has the value none(1) if no SA MAP Reject message has been received since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErro.name: docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErro.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.12 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmIpMulticastSAMapRejectErro.description: The value of this object is the text string in the most recent SA Map Reject message sent in response to an SA Map Request for this IP. It is a zero length string if no SA Map Reject message has been received since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCertTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCertTable
docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCertTable.description: This table describes the Baseline Privacy Plus device certificates for each CM MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCertEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCertEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCertEntry.description: Each entry contains the device certificates of one CM MAC interface. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMaclayer(127).

docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCmCert.name: docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCmCert
docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCmCert.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceCmCert.description: The X509 DER-encoded cable modem certificate. Note: This object can be set only when the value is the zero-length OCTET STRING, otherwise an error 'inconsistentValue' is returned. Once the object contains the certificate, its access MUST be read-only and persists after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceManufCert.name: docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceManufCert
docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceManufCert.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmDeviceManufCert.description: The X509 DER-encoded manufacturer certificate which signed the cable modem certificate.

docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteTable
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteTable.description: This table describes the Baseline Privacy Plus cryptographic suite capabilities for each CM MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteEntry.description: Each entry contains a cryptographic suite pair which this CM MAC supports.

docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteIndex.name: docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteIndex
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteIndex.description: The index for a cryptographic suite row.

docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataEncryptAlg.name: docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataEncryptAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataEncryptAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataEncryptAlg.description: The value of this object is the data encryption algorithm for this cryptographic suite capability.

docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataAuthentAlg.name: docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataAuthentAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataAuthentAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmCryptoSuiteDataAuthentAlg.description: The value of this object is the data authentication algorithm for this cryptographic suite capability.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsBaseTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsBaseTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsBaseTable.description: This table describes the basic Baseline Privacy attributes of each CMTS MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsBaseEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsBaseEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsBaseEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing attributes of one CMTS MAC interface. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMaclayer(127).

docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultAuthLifetime.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultAuthLifetime
docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultAuthLifetime.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultAuthLifetime.description: The value of this object is the default lifetime, in seconds, the CMTS assigns to a new authorization key. This object value persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultTEKLifetime.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultTEKLifetime
docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultTEKLifetime.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Appendix A.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultTEKLifetime.description: The value of this object is the default lifetime, in seconds, the CMTS assigns to a new Traffic Encryption Key (TEK). This object value persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultSelfSignedManufCe.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultSelfSignedManufCertTrust
docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultSelfSignedManufCe.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.1
docsIetfBpi2CmtsDefaultSelfSignedManufCe.description: This object determines the default trust of self-signed manufacturer certificate entries, contained in docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTable, created after setting this object. This object needs not to persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCheckCertValidityPeriods.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCheckCertValidityPeriods
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCheckCertValidityPeriods.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.2
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCheckCertValidityPeriods.description: Setting this object to 'true' causes all chained and root certificates in the chain to have their validity periods checked against the current time of day, when the CMTS receives an Authorization Request from the CM. A 'false' setting causes all certificates in the chain not to have their validity periods checked against the current time of day. This object needs not to persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthentInfos.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthentInfos
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthentInfos.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthentInfos.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received an Authentication Information message from any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received an Authorization Request message from any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an Authorization Reply message to any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an Authorization Reject message to any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalids.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalids
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalids.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.7.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalids.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an Authorization Invalid message to any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.10.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received an SA Map Request message from any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.11.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an SA Map Reply message to any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.12.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsSAMapRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an SA Map Reject message to any CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthTable.description: This table describes the attributes of each CM authorization association. The CMTS maintains one authorization association with each Baseline Privacy- enabled CM, registered on each CMTS MAC interface, regardless of whether the CM is authorized or rejected.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing attributes of one authorization association. The CMTS MUST create one entry per CM per MAC interface, based on the receipt of an Authorization Request message, and MUST not delete the entry until the CM loses registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmMacAddress.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmMacAddress
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmMacAddress.description: The value of this object is the physical address of the CM to which the authorization association applies.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmBpiVersion.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmBpiVersion
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmBpiVersion.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification Section 4.2.2.22; ANSI/SCTE 22-2 2002(formerly DSS 02-03) Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specification DOCSIS 1.0 Baseline Privacy Interface (BPI)
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmBpiVersion.description: The value of this object is the version of Baseline Privacy for which this CM has registered. The value 'bpiplus' represents the value of BPI-Version Attribute of the Baseline Privacy Key Management BPKM attribute BPI-Version (1). The value 'bpi' is used to represent the CM registered using DOCSIS 1.0 Baseline Privacy.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmPublicKey.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmPublicKey
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmPublicKey.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmPublicKey.description: The value of this object is a DER-encoded RSAPublicKey ASN.1 type string, as defined in the RSA Encryption Standard (PKCS #1), corresponding to the public key of the CM. This is the zero-length OCTET STRING if the CMTS does not retain the public key.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmKeySequenceNumber.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmKeySequenceNumber
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmKeySequenceNumber.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.2 and 4.2.2.10.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmKeySequenceNumber.description: The value of this object is the most recent authorization key sequence number for this CM.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresOld.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresOld
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresOld.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.2 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresOld.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the immediate predecessor of the most recent authorization key for this FSM. If this FSM has only one authorization key, then the value is the time of activation of this FSM. Note: This object has no meaning for CMs running in BPI mode, therefore this object is not instantiated for entries associated to those CMs.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresNew.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresNew
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresNew.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.2 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmExpiresNew.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the most recent authorization key for this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmLifetime.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmLifetime
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmLifetime.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.2 and Appendix A.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmLifetime.description: The value of this object is the lifetime, in seconds, the CMTS assigns to an authorization key for this CM.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReset.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReset
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReset.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.1.2.3.4, 4.1.2.3.5, and 4.1.3.3.5.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReset.description: Setting this object to invalidateAuth(2) causes the CMTS to invalidate the current CM authorization key(s), but not to transmit an Authorization Invalid message nor to invalidate the primary SAID's TEKs. Setting this object to sendAuthInvalid(3) causes the CMTS to invalidate the current CM authorization key(s), and to transmit an Authorization Invalid message to the CM, but not to invalidate the primary SAID's TEKs. Setting this object to invalidateTeks(4) causes the CMTS to invalidate the current CM authorization key(s), to transmit an Authorization Invalid message to the CM, and to invalidate the TEKs associated with this CM's primary SAID. For BPI mode, substitute all of the CM's unicast TEK(s) for the primary SAID's TEKs in the previous paragraph. Reading this object returns the most recently set value of this object, or returns noResetRequested(1) if the object has not been set since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInfos.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInfos
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInfos.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInfos.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received an Authentication Information message from this CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received an Authorization Request message from this CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an Authorization Reply message to this CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an Authorization Reject message to this CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInvalids.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInvalids
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInvalids.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.7.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCmInvalids.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an Authorization Invalid message to this CM. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.3 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in most recent Authorization Reject message transmitted to the CM. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no Authorization Reject message has been transmitted to the CM, since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.3 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthRejectErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in most recent Authorization Reject message transmitted to the CM. This is a zero length string if no Authorization Reject message has been transmitted to the CM, since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.7 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in most recent Authorization Invalid message transmitted to the CM. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no Authorization Invalid message has been transmitted to the CM since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.7 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthInvalidErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in most recent Authorization Invalid message transmitted to the CM. This is a zero length string if no Authorization Invalid message has been transmitted to the CM since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthPrimarySAId.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthPrimarySAId
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthPrimarySAId.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthPrimarySAId.description: The value of this object is the Primary Security Association identifier. For BPI mode, the value must be any unicast SID.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCertValid.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCertValid
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCertValid.reference: DOCSIS Security Specification CM-SP-SECv3.0-I08-080522, Certificate Revocation section.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCertValid.description: Contains the reason why a CM's certificate is deemed valid or invalid. Return unknown(0) if the CM is running BPI mode. ValidCmChained(1) means the certificate is valid because it chains to a valid certificate. ValidCmTrusted(2) means the certificate is valid because it has been provisioned (in the docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCert table) to be trusted. InvalidCmUntrusted(3) means the certificate is invalid because it has been provisioned (in the docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCert table) to be untrusted. InvalidCAUntrusted(4) means the certificate is invalid because it chains to an untrusted certificate. InvalidCmOther(5) and InvalidCAOther(6) refer to errors in parsing, validity periods, etc, which are attributable to the CM certificate or its chain respectively; additional information may be found in docsIetfBpi2AuthRejectErrorString for these types of errors. InvalidCmRevoked(7) means the certificate is invalid as it was marked as revoked. InvalidCARevoked(8) means the CA certificate is invalid as it was marked as revoked.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCert.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCert
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCert.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthBpkmCmCert.description: The X509 CM Certificate sent as part of a BPKM Authorization Request. Note: The zero-length OCTET STRING must be returned if the Entire certificate is not retained in the CMTS.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCACertIndexPtr.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCACertIndexPtr
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCACertIndexPtr.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsAuthCACertIndexPtr.description: A row index into docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTable. Returns the index in docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTable which CA certificate this CM is chained to. A value of 0 means it could not be found or not applicable.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKTable.description: This table describes the attributes of each Traffic Encryption Key (TEK) association. The CMTS Maintains one TEK association per SAID on each CMTS MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing attributes of one TEK association on a particular CMTS MAC interface. The CMTS MUST create one entry per SAID per MAC interface, based on the receipt of a Key Request message, and MUST not delete the entry before the CM authorization for the SAID permanently expires.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAId.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAId
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAId.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.12.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAId.description: The value of this object is the DOCSIS Security Association ID (SAID).

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAType.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAType
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAType.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKSAType.description: The value of this object is the type of security association. 'dynamic' does not apply to CMs running in BPI mode. Unicast BPI TEKs must utilize the 'primary' encoding and multicast BPI TEKs must utilize the 'static' encoding.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataEncryptAlg.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataEncryptAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataEncryptAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataEncryptAlg.description: The value of this object is the data encryption algorithm for this SAID.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataAuthentAlg.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataAuthentAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataAuthentAlg.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKDataAuthentAlg.description: The value of this object is the data authentication algorithm for this SAID.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKLifetime.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKLifetime
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKLifetime.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.5 and Appendix A.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKLifetime.description: The value of this object is the lifetime, in seconds, the CMTS assigns to keys for this TEK association.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKKeySequenceNumber.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKKeySequenceNumber
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKKeySequenceNumber.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.2.10 and 4.2.2.13.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKKeySequenceNumber.description: The value of this object is the most recent TEK key sequence number for this SAID.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresOld.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresOld
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresOld.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.5 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresOld.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the immediate predecessor of the most recent TEK for this FSM. If this FSM has only one TEK, then the value is the time of activation of this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresNew.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresNew
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresNew.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.5 and 4.2.2.9.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKExpiresNew.description: The value of this object is the actual clock time for expiration of the most recent TEK for this FSM.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKReset.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKReset
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKReset.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.1.3.3.5.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKReset.description: Setting this object to 'true' causes the CMTS to invalidate all currently active TEK(s) and to generate new TEK(s) for the associated SAID; the CMTS MAY also generate unsolicited TEK Invalid message(s), to optimize the TEK synchronization between the CMTS and the CM(s). Reading this object always returns FALSE.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.4.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received a Key Request message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.5.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted a Key Reply message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted a Key Reject message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalids.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalids
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalids.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.8.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalids.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted a TEK Invalid message. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.6 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in the most recent Key Reject message sent in response to a Key Request for this SAID. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no Key Reject message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.6 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsKeyRejectErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in the most recent Key Reject message sent in response to a Key Request for this SAID. This is a zero length string if no Key Reject message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.8 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorCode.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in the most recent TEK Invalid message sent in association with this SAID. This has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code value was 0, and none(1) if no TEK Invalid message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorString.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.8 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsTEKInvalidErrorString.description: The value of this object is the text string in the most recent TEK Invalid message sent in association with this SAID. This is a zero length string if no TEK Invalid message has been received since registration.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapTable.description: This table maps multicast IP addresses to SAIDs. If a multicast IP address is mapped by multiple rows in the table, the row with the lowest docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastIndex must be utilized for the mapping.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing the mapping of a set of multicast IP address and mask to one SAID associated to a CMTS MAC Interface, as well as associated message counters and error information.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastIndex.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastIndex
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastIndex.description: The index of this row. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar objects in the row.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddressType.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddressType
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddressType.description: The type of internet address for docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddress and docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddress.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddress
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddress.description: This object represents the IP multicast address to be mapped, in conjunction with docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask. The type of this address is determined by the value of the object docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddressType.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask.description: This object represents the IP multicast address mask for this row. An IP multicast address matches this row if the logical AND of the address with docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask is identical to the logical AND of docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddr with docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask. The type of this address is determined by the value of the object docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddressType. Note: For IPv6 this object needs not to represent a contiguous netmask, e.g. to associate an SAID to a multicast group matching 'any' multicast scope. The TC InetAddressPrefixLength is not used because it only represents contiguous netmask.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAId.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAId
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAId.description: This object represents the multicast SAID to be used in this IP multicast address mapping entry.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAType.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAType
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAType.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 2.1.3.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAType.description: The value of this object is the type of security association. 'dynamic' does not apply to CMs running in BPI mode. Unicast BPI TEKs must utilize the 'primary' encoding and multicast BPI TEKs must utilize the 'static' encoding. SNMP created entries set this object by default to 'static' if not set at row creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataEncryptAl.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataEncryptAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataEncryptAl.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataEncryptAl.description: The value of this object is the data encryption algorithm for this IP.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataAuthentAl.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataAuthentAlg
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataAuthentAl.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.2.20.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastDataAuthentAl.description: The value of this object is the data authentication algorithm for this IP.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRequests.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRequests
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRequests.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.10.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRequests.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has received an SA Map Request message for this IP. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapReplies.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapReplies
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapReplies.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.11.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapReplies.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an SA Map Reply message for this IP. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejects.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejects
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejects.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 4.2.1.12.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejects.description: The value of this object is the count of times the CMTS has transmitted an SA Map Reject message for this IP. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectEr.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectErrorCode
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectEr.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.12 and 4.2.2.15.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectEr.description: The value of this object is the enumerated description of the Error-Code in the most recent SA Map Reject message sent in response to a SA Map Request for This IP. It has value unknown(2) if the last Error-Code Value was 0, and none(1) if no SA MAP Reject message has been received since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectEr.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectErrorString
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectEr.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Sections 4.2.1.12 and 4.2.2.6.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAMapRejectEr.description: The value of this object is the text string in the most recent SA Map Reject message sent in response to an SA Map Request for this IP. It is a zero length string if no SA Map Reject message has been received since entry creation.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapControl.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapControl
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapControl.description: This object controls and reflects the IP multicast address mapping entry. There is no restriction on the ability to change values in this row while the row is active. A created row can be set to active only after the Corresponding instances of docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastAddress, docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMask, docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAId and docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastSAType have all been set.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapStorageTyp.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapStorageType
docsIetfBpi2CmtsIpMulticastMapStorageTyp.description: The storage type for this conceptual row. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar objects in the row.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthTable.description: This table describes the multicast SAID authorization for each CM on each CMTS MAC interface.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthEntry.description: Each entry contains objects describing the key authorization of one cable modem for one multicast SAID for one CMTS MAC interface. Row entries persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthSAId.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthSAId
docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthSAId.description: This object represents the multicast SAID for authorization.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthCmMacAddres.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthCmMacAddress
docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthCmMacAddres.description: This object represents the MAC address of the CM to which the multicast SAID authorization applies.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthControl.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthControl
docsIetfBpi2CmtsMulticastAuthControl.description: The status of this conceptual row for the authorization of multicast SAIDs to CMs.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTable.description: A table of CM certificate trust entries provisioned to the CMTS. The trust object for a certificate in this table has an overriding effect on the validity object of a certificate in the authorization table, as long as the entire contents of the two certificates are identical.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertEntry.reference: Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Operations Support System Interface Specification SP-OSSIv2.0-I05-040407, Section 6.2.14
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertEntry.description: An entry in the CMTS's provisioned CM certificate table. Row entries persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTrust.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTrust
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTrust.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertTrust.description: Trust state for the provisioned CM certificate entry. Note: Setting this object need only override the validity of CM certificates sent in future authorization requests; instantaneous effect need not occur.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertSource.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertSource
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertSource.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.1.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertSource.description: This object indicates how the certificate reached the CMTS. Other(4) means is originated from a source not identified above.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertStatus.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertStatus
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCertStatus.description: The status of this conceptual row. Values in this row cannot be changed while the row is 'active'.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCert.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCert
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCert.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsProvisionedCmCert.description: An X509 DER-encoded Certificate Authority certificate. Note: The zero-length OCTET STRING must be returned, on reads, if the entire certificate is not retained in the CMTS.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTable.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTable
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTable.description: The table of known Certificate Authority certificates acquired by this device.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertEntry.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertEntry
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertEntry.reference: Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Operations Support System Interface Specification SP-OSSIv2.0-I05-040407, Section 6.2.14
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertEntry.description: A row in the Certificate Authority certificate table. Row entries with trust status 'trusted', 'untrusted', or 'root' persist after re-initialization of the managed system.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSubject.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSubject
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSubject.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.4
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSubject.description: The subject name exactly as it is encoded in the X509 certificate. The organizationName portion of the certificate's subject name must be present. All other fields are optional. Any optional field present must be pre pended with <CR> (carriage return, U+000D) <LF> (line feed, U+000A). Ordering of fields present must conform to: organizationName <CR> <LF> countryName <CR> <LF> stateOrProvinceName <CR> <LF> localityName <CR> <LF> organizationalUnitName <CR> <LF> organizationalUnitName=<Manufacturing Location> <CR> <LF> commonName

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertIssuer.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertIssuer
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertIssuer.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.4
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertIssuer.description: The issuer name exactly as it is encoded in the X509 certificate. The commonName portion of the certificate's issuer name must be present. All other fields are optional. Any optional field present must be pre pended with <CR> (carriage return, U+000D) <LF> (line feed, U+000A). Ordering of fields present must conform to: CommonName <CR><LF> countryName <CR><LF> stateOrProvinceName <CR><LF> localityName <CR><LF> organizationName <CR><LF> organizationalUnitName <CR><LF> organizationalUnitName=<Manufacturing Location>

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSerialNumber.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSerialNumber
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSerialNumber.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.2
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSerialNumber.description: This CA certificate's serial number represented as an octet string.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTrust.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTrust
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTrust.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.1
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTrust.description: This object controls the trust status of this certificate. Root certificates must be given root(4) trust; manufacturer certificates must not be given root(4) trust. Trust on root certificates must not change. Note: Setting this object need only affect the validity of CM certificates sent in future authorization requests; instantaneous effect need not occur.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSource.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSource
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSource.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.1
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertSource.description: This object indicates how the certificate reached the CMTS. Other(4) means it originated from a source not identified above.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertStatus.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertStatus
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertStatus.description: The status of this conceptual row. An attempt to set writable columnar values while this row is active behaves as follows: - Sets to the object docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertTrust are allowed. - Sets to the object docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert will return an error inconsistentValue'. A newly create entry cannot be set to active until the value of docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert is being set.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.2.
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert.description: An X509 DER-encoded Certificate Authority certificate. To help identify certificates, either this object or docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertThumbprint must be returned by a CMTS for self-signed CA certificates. Note: The zero-length OCTET STRING must be returned, on reads, if the entire certificate is not retained in the CMTS.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertThumbprint.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertThumbprint
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertThumbprint.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section 9.4.3
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACertThumbprint.description: The SHA-1 hash of a CA certificate. To help identify certificates, either this object or docsIetfBpi2CmtsCACert must be returned by a CMTS for self-signed CA certificates. Note: The zero-length OCTET STRING must be returned, on reads, if the CA certificate thumb print is not retained in the CMTS.

docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusCode.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusCode
docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusCode.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.3.2 & D.3.5.1.
docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusCode.description: The value indicates the result of the latest config file CVC verification, SNMP CVC verification, or code file verification.

docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusString.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusString
docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusString.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section TBD (see D.3.7)
docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadStatusString.description: The value of this object indicates the additional information to the status code. The value will include the error code and error description which will be defined separately.

docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgOrgName.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgOrgName
docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgOrgName.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgOrgName.description: The value of this object is the device manufacturer's organizationName.

docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCodeAccessStart.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCodeAccessStart
docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCodeAccessStart.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCodeAccessStart.description: The value of this object is the device manufacturer's current codeAccessStart value. This value always be referenced to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and the value format must contain TimeZone information (fields 8-10).

docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCvcAccessStart.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCvcAccessStart
docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCvcAccessStart.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeMfgCvcAccessStart.description: The value of this object is the device manufacturer's current cvcAccessStart value. This value always be referenced to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and the value format must contain TimeZone information (fields 8-10).

docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerOrgName.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerOrgName
docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerOrgName.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerOrgName.description: The value of this object is the Co-Signer's organizationName. The value is a zero length string if the co-signer is not specified.

docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCodeAccessStart.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCodeAccessStart
docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCodeAccessStart.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCodeAccessStart.description: The value of this object is the Co-Signer's current codeAccessStart value. This value always be referenced to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and the value format must contain TimeZone information (fields 8-10). If docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerOrgName is a zero length string, the value of this object is meaningless.

docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCvcAccessStart.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCvcAccessStart
docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCvcAccessStart.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerCvcAccessStart.description: The value of this object is the Co-Signer's current cvcAccessStart value. This value always be referenced to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and the value format must contain TimeZone information (fields 8-10). If docsIetfBpi2CodeCoSignerOrgName is a zero length string, the value of this object is meaningless.

docsIetfBpi2CodeCvcUpdate.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeCvcUpdate
docsIetfBpi2CodeCvcUpdate.reference: DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Plus Interface Specification, Section D.3.3.2.2.
docsIetfBpi2CodeCvcUpdate.description: Setting a CVC to this object triggers the device to verify the CVC and update the cvcAccessStart values, then the content of this object is discarded.. If the device is not enabled to upgrade codefiles, or the CVC verification fails, the CVC will be rejected. Reading this object always returns the zero-length OCTET STRING.

docsIetfBpi2CmCompliance.name: docsIetfBpi2CmCompliance
docsIetfBpi2CmCompliance.description: This is the compliance statement for CMs which implement the DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Interface Plus.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsCompliance.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsCompliance
docsIetfBpi2CmtsCompliance.description: This is the compliance statement for CMTSs which implement the DOCSIS Baseline Privacy Interface Plus.

docsIetfBpi2CmGroup.name: docsIetfBpi2CmGroup
docsIetfBpi2CmGroup.description: This collection of objects provides CM BPI+ status and control.

docsIetfBpi2CmtsGroup.name: docsIetfBpi2CmtsGroup
docsIetfBpi2CmtsGroup.description: This collection of objects provides CMTS BPI+ status and control.

docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadGroup.name: docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadGroup
docsIetfBpi2CodeDownloadGroup.description: This collection of objects provide authenticated software download support.
